channel.title: What Is Happening To This World
channel.description:
First, it's Ed McMahon. Then, it's Farrah Fawcett. Third, it's Michael Jackson. Finally, it's Billy Mays.
Really, what is happening to this world?
R.I.P.
P.S. I actually liked commercials with Billy Mays in them.

item.title: What Is Happening To This World
item.dc:creator: @jjones10 jjones10
item.description:
@jjones10 wrote:

celebrities usually have heart problems because of the daily stress they go through with paparazi, lawsuits, and their professions. Thats why they usually die young, because they cant take it anymore.

Read full topic

[quote=“Lin, post:12, topic:285977”]Wow, you guys are all fucking stupid.
OH MY GOD! FOUR PEOPLE MANY PEOPLE KNOW HAVE DIED! IT’S THE END OF THE WORLD! OH NO!

It’s just a coincidence that they all died one right after another. Not everyone lives forever you know.[/quote]

Of course no one lives forever, but they died at 50, not at like 80 which is the average or something.

item.source: What Is Happening To This World

item.title: What Is Happening To This World
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

Billy T James died

Billy T James, (1948  August 07, 1991), born William James Taitoko, was a New Zealand entertainer, comedian and actor. He starred in numerous TV shows and variety programs, performed on stage and in motion pictures. He joined the Maori Volcanics Showband in the 1970s and performed around the world. Going solo in Australia and then New Zealand saw him in great demand for his skits and impressions and his cabaret singing.

He starred with Peter Rowley and Annie Whittle in a series of sketches, and starred in Radio Times, on TV in 1980 and the feature film Came a Hot Friday, directed by Ian Mune in 1985. He was New Zealand Entertainer of the Year in 1981 and Entertainer of the Decade in 1985. He and Chris Slane wrote a comic book in 1986 called Billy T James Real Hard Case, and a second comic book in 1987 called Real Hard Case 2. Billy also provided a voice for the 1986 animated film, Footrot Flats: The Dog’s Tail. He and Tom Parkinson, of Isambard Productions, devised a 1989 sitcom, The Billy T James Show. Starring effectively as himself, James’ co-stars were Ilona Rodgers and Mark Hadlow, with Tania Wehi and Willa O’Neill. The pilot for the series was not broadcast, but was included on Te Video Billy T James and Friends, a VHS compilation of classic James moments released by Isambard Productions. His last television performance was the hour long The Billy T James Show Christmas special in 1990(?).

After his heart transplant in 1988, Billy returned to the stage in 1990, in the variety special Billy T James, Alive and Giggling. Among the special guests was Howard Morrison, another famous Maori entertainer. James’ health deteriorated swiftly following the stage show, and he died from a heart attack on 7 August 1991. He was well known for his yellow towel, black singlet and black shorts seen in skits,Te News and Marae Witness News. He is also known for his famous ‘Maori chuckle’. He said: “If it wasn’t for the Poms you’d all be the same colour as me, mate!”, and “I’m half Scot, half Maori. One half wants to get pissed (drunk) and the other doesn’t want to pay for it”.

Thanks Wiki ;)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 30, 2009, 02:08:32 am[/size][hr]People dont last forever =\

Read full topic
item.source: What Is Happening To This World

item.title: What Is Happening To This World
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“Aeolian, post:42, topic:285977”][quote author=iCreatedHorror link=topic=378230.msg2846679#msg2846679 date=1246318914]

Off Topic: Crying is selfish.

Wow, that actually makes least amount of sense.

You cry when a person dies because you have lost a part of your life. You are not crying for their death. You’re crying because you are losing something, which makes you selfish.

I was crying for their death, you moron. From that comment, you never lost anyone close. I did lose a friend, but I know he’s in a better place and that I need to move on.

That’s what this society has brought you up to think. From that comment, you have already showed your lack of intellect. You are not crying because the person cannot ‘enjoy’ this world any more. You are crying merely because you’ve lost something important in your life.

Right, 4.0 student, going into junior year of HS at a tough school. Right, lack of intellect. And yes, I am crying because I lost someone, your right. But also, I am Catholic, he is in a better place, so GTFO.
I can tell from this little conversation, your a dick.

Here is the link, leave me alone.
R.I.P. Major

I received a 4.0+ this past year as a sophomore in high school. Not hard at all. High school is a joke. Alright, so you proved my point for me. If he is in a better place, then why the hell would you be crying? Shouldn’t you be laughing with joy?

Again, you’ve proved you’re a dick. No, while I understand he’s in a better place, he’s dead, he’s gone. Honestly, do you even know how hard it was to get through that week? Jc, just leave me alone.

I’m not directing this towards any of the posts here. I haven’t read the majority of the posts, and I haven’t read yours. I was only stating that crying is a form of selfishness. He’s dead. He’s gone. You cry. Who are you crying for? Yourself. You’re crying, once again, because part of your life is gone, not because he cannot enjoy this ‘wonderful’ world.

This world is far from wonderful. And I’m done with you, post what you want, I’m ignoring it. And I cried for his dad; he lost his only child and wife to some moron who got drunk and decided to drive without a license. His dad lost part of his life, not me. Once again, I’m done with your damn posts about me being selfish because a friend died.
[/quote]

 Jc as well as you are selfish. Humans are selfish by nature. It's just how we are programmed. He's not telling you that you're a horrible person for crying. He was simply stating that crying is simply a selfish act because it's not to benefit anyone; it's simply just because you've lost something. Also, he's not being a dick. He's being realistic. 

 A 4.0 in high school is not an achievement by the way. I'm not saying you're mentally retarded. I'm simply stating that High School isn't all that hard. I'm a Sophomore and I'm taking college classes so I can get my associates degree when I graduate. It doesn't mean I'm smart.[/quote]

At least someone understands. And yes, 4.0 in high school is nothing.

Tons of people, including myself, take college courses in high school. It’s not even an achievement, and if you can’t take college courses becuase you’re not ready for them, try to take them… They’re so easy.

Read full topic
item.source: What Is Happening To This World

item.title: What Is Happening To This World
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan
item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

[quote=“pure ess ftw, post:25, topic:285977”][quote author=casey. link=topic=378230.msg2846214#msg2846214 date=1246298779]
In other news, 300 American Soldiers died in Iraq.
[/quote]
No one pays enough respect about them tbh(not saying i do\dont. It is just a fact.) Families do, anyone else=no. It is only because they are known. It doesnt matter if they are trying to defend the country for us not to get killed.[/quote]
Actually, as a matter of fact, I do. Those soldiers don’t need to be there anymore. Bush and Obama said they’d pull them out. That hasn’t happened.

krackkid:

lozl the worlds ending OMGS@!!!.. no things like this just happen yes its weird in all cause there most celeb’s but you got to remember someone dies ever few seconds and no one cares but as soon as a celeb does it goes on news and everthing its really no big deal but yes I will miss them R.I.P

Question for you. Why would the whole world care if someone died? I lost a good friend at school this year because of a drunk driver, and what mattered is that those who Knew him were there for him and his family. His funeral turned out somewhere in the 850+ region of people (with around 550 being students). The rest were his family and people no one knew just being their to support the students and the family. Having those that cared about him being there is all that mattered.
R.I.P Major.

Read full topic
